subject: Communication
title: The Psychology of Touch
description: A quick win: understand The Psychology of Touch.

hook.text: A waitress touches your arm for one second. You tip 20% more. You don't even know why.

buildup.text: Touch is our most primitive communication channel. It releases oxytocin and builds trust instantly.

discovery.text: Researchers found that a brief touch increases compliance with requests, donations, and even exam performance.

twist.text: But unwanted touch triggers the opposite: cortisol spikes, defensive behavior, and lasting negative impressions.

climax.text: The line between positive and invasive touch depends on context, relationship, consent, and culture.

punchline.text: Touch can build trust in a second or break it forever.

quiz.question: What hormone does positive touch release?
